meanings.definition: To feel or show fear or apprehension
meanings.sent1: The little girl would quail at the sight of thunderstorms.
meanings.sent2: I quail at the thought of speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The brave knight pretended to quail in fear to entertain the children.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence seemed to quail in the face of the intimidating challenge.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence made him quail as he walked through the dark forest.

meanings.sent1: The quail scurried across the field in search of food.
meanings.sent2: We spotted a covey of quail during our nature hike.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious dish using fresh quail meat.
meanings.sent4: The quail's distinctive call echoed through the woods.
meanings.sent5: The hunter patiently waited for the quail to emerge from the bushes.

meanings.definition: To recoil in dread or terror
meanings.sent1: She would quail at the mere mention of the haunted house.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected loud noise made him quail in fear.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie made the audience quail in their seats.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to quail as he approached the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure made the brave explorer quail in terror.
